news_header: Sunandan Das, an Indian snake expert at the University of Helsinki, has a lifelong passion for snakes, including toxic species. He conducts research on reptile evolution and genetics, having made significant discoveries in the field.
news_text: Sunandan Das, originally from Kolkata, India, now works at the University of Helsinki, where he studies reptiles, particularly snakes. He has a deep-rooted passion for snakes, nurtured from childhood, and has experience handling toxic species. Das has made notable contributions to herpetology, including the discovery of a new tribe of snakes, Micrelapidae. He emphasizes the importance of biodiversity research in protecting reptiles, especially in the face of climate change. At home in Helsinki, he keeps several snakes, ensuring they are well cared for. Das enjoys his work and is focused on completing his dissertation, which may lead him to new opportunities.
